Docs.summary: Determines what to do when the <see cref="T:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener"> object attempts to write to a log and there is less free disk space available than specified by the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener.ReserveDiskSpace%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener.DiskSpaceExhaustedBehavior%2A> property is set to F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.DiskSpaceExhaustedOption.DiscardMessages?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, the log messages are by default discarded if there is not enough reserved disk space. This prevents simple applications from failing if the disk gets too full.
For a more robust application, set the P:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.FileLogTraceListener.DiskSpaceExhaustedBehavior?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True property to F:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Logging.DiskSpaceExhaustedOption.ThrowException?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, and add `Try...Catch` blocks around all code that writes to the log.
